diagnosis.final_diagnosis: Chronic recurrent abdominal pain caused by intermittent torsion of an accessory spleen.
diagnosis.diagnostic_reasoning: The patient's history of recurrent abdominal pain and vomiting prompted consideration of several alternative diagnoses. Initial evaluations favored constipation, but persistent pain despite treatment led to further exploration. An abdominal CT scan revealed an accessory spleen, which was suspected to be intermittently torsed, culminating in the final diagnosis.
